message.content:
cs.GT, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.DS, cs.CR 

The paper deals with incentivizing individuals to provide accurate evaluations, which is a problem in game theory (cs.GT) and machine learning (cs.AI). The use of peer prediction mechanisms is a common approach in this area, which falls under the category of learning theory (cs.LG). The paper also discusses the use of limited access to ground truth, which involves statistical inference and data analysis (cs.DS) as well as cryptography (cs.CR) to ensure the trustworthiness of the evaluations.
